arabic_text: إِنَّآ أَرۡسَلۡنَا نُوحًا إِلَىٰ قَوۡمِهِۦٓ أَنۡ أَنذِرۡ قَوۡمَكَ مِن قَبۡلِ أَن يَأۡتِيَهُمۡ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٞ
phonetic: 71.1 'Innā 'Arsalnā Nūĥāan 'Ilá Qawmihi 'An 'Andhir Qawmaka Min Qabli 'An Ya'tiyahum `Adhābun 'Alīmun

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, We sent Noah to his people, [saying], "Warn your people before there comes to them a painful punishment."
translations.english_hilali_khan: 1. Verily, We sent Nûh (Noah) to his people (saying): "Warn your people before there comes to them a painful torment."
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, We sent Noah to his people, “Warn your people before there comes to them a painful punishment.”

arabic_text: قَالَ يَٰقَوۡمِ إِنِّي لَكُمۡ نَذِيرٞ مُّبِينٌ
phonetic: 71.2 Qāla Yā Qawmi 'Innī Lakum Nadhīrun Mubīnun

translations.english_saheeh: He said, "O my people, indeed I am to you a clear warner -
translations.english_hilali_khan: He said: "O my people! Verily, I am a plain warner to you,
translations.english_rwwad: He said: “O my people, indeed I am a clear warner to you,

arabic_text: أَنِ ٱعۡبُدُواْ ٱللَّهَ وَٱتَّقُوهُ وَأَطِيعُونِ
phonetic: 71.3 'Ani A`budū Allāha Wa Attaqūhu Wa 'Aţī`ūni

translations.english_saheeh: To worship Allāh, fear Him and obey me.
translations.english_hilali_khan: "That you should worship Allâh (Alone), fear (be dutiful to) Him, and obey me,
translations.english_rwwad: that you worship Allah and fear Him, and obey me;

arabic_text: يَغۡفِرۡ لَكُم مِّن ذُنُوبِكُمۡ وَيُؤَخِّرۡكُمۡ إِلَىٰٓ أَجَلٖ مُّسَمًّىۚ إِنَّ أَجَلَ ٱللَّهِ إِذَا جَآءَ لَا يُؤَخَّرُۚ لَوۡ كُنتُمۡ تَعۡلَمُونَ
phonetic: 71.4 Yaghfir Lakum Min Dhunūbikum Wa Yu'uakhkhirkum 'Ilá 'Ajalin Musammáan 'Inna 'Ajala Allāhi 'Idhā Jā'a Lā Yu'uakhkharu Law Kuntum Ta`lamūna

translations.english_saheeh: He [i.e., Allāh] will forgive you of your sins and delay you for a specified term. Indeed, the time [set by] Allāh, when it comes, will not be delayed, if you only knew."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "He (Allâh) will forgive you of your sins and respite you to an appointed term. Verily, the term of Allâh when it comes, cannot be delayed, if you but knew."
translations.english_rwwad: He will forgive you some of your sins and grant you respite until an appointed term. Indeed, when Allah’s appointed term comes, it cannot be delayed, if you only knew!”

arabic_text: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّي دَعَوۡتُ قَوۡمِي لَيۡلٗا وَنَهَارٗا
phonetic: 71.5 Qāla Rabbi 'Innī Da`awtu Qawmī Laylāan Wa Nahārāan

translations.english_saheeh: He said, "My Lord, indeed I invited my people [to truth] night and day.
translations.english_hilali_khan: He said: "O my Lord! Verily, I have called to my people night and day (i.e. secretly and openly to accept the doctrine of Islâmic Monotheism),[2]
translations.english_rwwad: He said, “My Lord, I have surely called my people night and day,

arabic_text: فَلَمۡ يَزِدۡهُمۡ دُعَآءِيٓ إِلَّا فِرَارٗا
phonetic: 71.6 Falam Yazid/hum Du`ā'ī 'Illā Firārāan

translations.english_saheeh: But my invitation increased them not except in flight [i.e., aversion].
translations.english_hilali_khan: "But all my calling added nothing but to (their) flight (from the truth).
translations.english_rwwad: but my call only drove them further away.

arabic_text: وَإِنِّي كُلَّمَا دَعَوۡتُهُمۡ لِتَغۡفِرَ لَهُمۡ جَعَلُوٓاْ أَصَٰبِعَهُمۡ فِيٓ ءَاذَانِهِمۡ وَٱسۡتَغۡشَوۡاْ ثِيَابَهُمۡ وَأَصَرُّواْ وَٱسۡتَكۡبَرُواْ ٱسۡتِكۡبَارٗا
phonetic: 71.7 Wa 'Innī Kullamā Da`awtuhum Litaghfira Lahum Ja`alū 'Aşābi`ahum Fī 'Ādhānihim Wa Astaghshaw Thiyābahum Wa 'Aşarrū Wa Astakbarū Astikbārāan

translations.english_saheeh: And indeed, every time I invited them that You may forgive them, they put their fingers in their ears, covered themselves with their garments,[1761] persisted, and were arrogant with [great] arrogance.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And verily, every time I called unto them that You might forgive them, they thrust their fingers into their ears, covered themselves up with their garments, and persisted (in their refusal), and magnified themselves in pride.
translations.english_rwwad: Every time I call them so that You may forgive them, they thrust their fingers into their ears and cover their faces with their garments, and persist in obstinacy and grow extremely arrogant.

arabic_text: ثُمَّ إِنِّي دَعَوۡتُهُمۡ جِهَارٗا
phonetic: 71.8 Thumma 'Innī Da`awtuhum Jihārāan

translations.english_saheeh: Then I invited them publicly.
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Then verily, I called to them openly (aloud).
translations.english_rwwad: Then I called them openly,

arabic_text: ثُمَّ إِنِّيٓ أَعۡلَنتُ لَهُمۡ وَأَسۡرَرۡتُ لَهُمۡ إِسۡرَارٗا
phonetic: 71.9 Thumma 'Innī 'A`lantu Lahum Wa 'Asrartu Lahum 'Isrārāan

translations.english_saheeh: Then I announced to them and [also] confided to them secretly
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Then verily, I proclaimed to them in public, and I have appealed to them in private.
translations.english_rwwad: then I addressed them in public and in private,

arabic_text: فَقُلۡتُ ٱسۡتَغۡفِرُواْ رَبَّكُمۡ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ غَفَّارٗا
phonetic: 71.10 Faqultu Astaghfirū Rabbakum 'Innahu Kāna Ghaffārāan

translations.english_saheeh: And said, 'Ask forgiveness of your Lord. Indeed, He is ever a Perpetual Forgiver.
translations.english_hilali_khan: "I said (to them): ‘Ask forgiveness from your Lord, verily, He is Oft-Forgiving;
translations.english_rwwad: I said, ‘Seek forgiveness from your Lord. Indeed, He is Most Forgiving.

arabic_text: يُرۡسِلِ ٱلسَّمَآءَ عَلَيۡكُم مِّدۡرَارٗا
phonetic: 71.11 Yursili As-Samā'a `Alaykum Midrārāan

translations.english_saheeh: He will send [rain from] the sky upon you in [continuing] showers
translations.english_hilali_khan: ‘He will send rain to you in abundance,
translations.english_rwwad: He will shower you with abundant rain from the sky,

arabic_text: وَيُمۡدِدۡكُم بِأَمۡوَٰلٖ وَبَنِينَ وَيَجۡعَل لَّكُمۡ جَنَّٰتٖ وَيَجۡعَل لَّكُمۡ أَنۡهَٰرٗا
phonetic: 71.12 Wa Yumdidkum Bi'amwālin Wa Banīna Wa Yaj`al Lakum Jannātin Wa Yaj`al Lakum 'Anhārāan

translations.english_saheeh: And give you increase in wealth and children and provide for you gardens and provide for you rivers.
translations.english_hilali_khan: ‘And give you increase in wealth and children, and bestow on you gardens and bestow on you rivers.’"
translations.english_rwwad: and He will give you wealth and children, and bestow upon you gardens and rivers.

arabic_text: مَّا لَكُمۡ لَا تَرۡجُونَ لِلَّهِ وَقَارٗا
phonetic: 71.13 Mā Lakum Lā Tarjūna Lillāhi Waqārāan

translations.english_saheeh: What is [the matter] with you that you do not attribute to Allāh [due] grandeur
translations.english_hilali_khan: What is the matter with you, that [you fear not Allâh (His punishment), and] you hope not for reward (from Allâh or you believe not in His Oneness).
translations.english_rwwad: What is the matter with you that you do not fear the Majesty of Allah,

arabic_text: وَقَدۡ خَلَقَكُمۡ أَطۡوَارًا
phonetic: 71.14 Wa Qad Khalaqakum 'Aţwārāan

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1762]- i.e., in various progressive states and conditions.  See also 22:5 and 23:12-14 in reference to development of the embryo.

translations.english_saheeh: While He has created you in stages?[1762]
translations.english_hilali_khan: While He has created you in (different) stages [i.e. first Nutfah, then ‘Alaqah and then Mudghah, see (V.23:13,14)].
translations.english_rwwad: when He has created you in stages?

arabic_text: أَلَمۡ تَرَوۡاْ كَيۡفَ خَلَقَ ٱللَّهُ سَبۡعَ سَمَٰوَٰتٖ طِبَاقٗا
phonetic: 71.15 'Alam Taraw Kayfa Khalaqa Allāhu Sab`a Samāwātin Ţibāqāan

translations.english_saheeh: Do you not consider how Allāh has created seven heavens in layers[1763]
translations.english_hilali_khan: See you not how Allâh has created the seven heavens one above another?
translations.english_rwwad: Do you not see how Allah has created seven heavens, one above another,

arabic_text: وَجَعَلَ ٱلۡقَمَرَ فِيهِنَّ نُورٗا وَجَعَلَ ٱلشَّمۡسَ سِرَاجٗا
phonetic: 71.16 Wa Ja`ala Al-Qamara Fīhinna Nūrāan Wa Ja`ala Ash-Shamsa Sirājāan

translations.english_saheeh: And made the moon therein a [reflected] light and made the sun a burning lamp?
translations.english_hilali_khan: And has made the moon a light therein, and made the sun a lamp?
translations.english_rwwad: and has placed the moon therein as a light and the sun as a burning lamp?

arabic_text: وَٱللَّهُ أَنۢبَتَكُم مِّنَ ٱلۡأَرۡضِ نَبَاتٗا
phonetic: 71.17 Wa Allāhu 'Anbatakum Mina Al-'Arđi Nabātāan

translations.english_saheeh: And Allāh has caused you to grow from the earth a [progressive] growth.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And Allâh has brought you forth from the (dust of) earth? (Tafsir At-Tabarî)
translations.english_rwwad: Allah has produced you from the earth like a plant,

arabic_text: ثُمَّ يُعِيدُكُمۡ فِيهَا وَيُخۡرِجُكُمۡ إِخۡرَاجٗا
phonetic: 71.18 Thumma Yu`īdukum Fīhā Wa Yukhrijukum 'Ikhrājāan

translations.english_saheeh: Then He will return you into it and extract you [another] extraction.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Afterwards He will return you into it (the earth), and bring you forth (again on the Day of Resurrection)?
translations.english_rwwad: then He will return you into it, and then will bring you out again.

arabic_text: وَٱللَّهُ جَعَلَ لَكُمُ ٱلۡأَرۡضَ بِسَاطٗا
phonetic: 71.19 Wa Allāhu Ja`ala Lakumu Al-'Arđa Bisāţāan

translations.english_saheeh: And Allāh has made for you the earth an expanse
translations.english_hilali_khan: And Allâh has made for you the earth a wide expanse.
translations.english_rwwad: Allah has made the earth wide spread for you

arabic_text: لِّتَسۡلُكُواْ مِنۡهَا سُبُلٗا فِجَاجٗا
phonetic: 71.20 Litaslukū Minhā Subulāan Fijājāan

translations.english_saheeh: That you may follow therein roads of passage.'"
translations.english_hilali_khan: That you may go about therein in broad roads.
translations.english_rwwad: so that you may tread its spacious paths.’”

arabic_text: قَالَ نُوحٞ رَّبِّ إِنَّهُمۡ عَصَوۡنِي وَٱتَّبَعُواْ مَن لَّمۡ يَزِدۡهُ مَالُهُۥ وَوَلَدُهُۥٓ إِلَّا خَسَارٗا
phonetic: 71.21 Qāla Nūĥun Rabbi 'Innahum `Aşawnī Wa Attaba`ū Man Lam Yazid/hu Māluhu Wa Waladuhu 'Illā Khasārāan

translations.english_saheeh: Noah said, "My Lord, indeed they have disobeyed me and followed him whose wealth and children will not increase him except in loss.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Nûh (Noah) said: "My Lord! They have disobeyed me, and followed one whose wealth and children give him no increase but loss.
translations.english_rwwad: Noah said, “My Lord, they have disobeyed me and followed those whose wealth and children did not increase them except in loss.

arabic_text: وَمَكَرُواْ مَكۡرٗا كُبَّارٗا
phonetic: 71.22 Wa Makarū Makrāan Kubbārāan

translations.english_saheeh: And they conspired an immense conspiracy
translations.english_hilali_khan: "And they have plotted a mighty plot.
translations.english_rwwad: They have contrived a mighty plot,

arabic_text: وَقَالُواْ لَا تَذَرُنَّ ءَالِهَتَكُمۡ وَلَا تَذَرُنَّ وَدّٗا وَلَا سُوَاعٗا وَلَا يَغُوثَ وَيَعُوقَ وَنَسۡرٗا
phonetic: 71.23 Wa Qālū Lā Tadharunna 'Ālihatakum Wa Lā Tadharunna Waddāan Wa Lā Suwā`āan Wa Lā Yaghūtha Wa Ya`ūqa Wa Nasrāan

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1764]- These were the names of specific idols named after pious men of earlier generations.

translations.english_saheeh: And said, 'Never leave your gods and never leave Wadd or Suwāʿ or Yaghūth and Yaʿūq and Nasr.'[1764]
translations.english_hilali_khan: "And they have said: ‘You shall not leave your gods: nor shall you leave Wadd, nor Suwâ‘, nor Yaghûth, nor Ya‘ûq nor Nasr’ (these are the names of their idols).
translations.english_rwwad: They said, ‘Do not abandon your gods; and do not abandon Wadd, Suwā‘, Yaghūth, Ya‘ūq, and Nasr.’

arabic_text: وَقَدۡ أَضَلُّواْ كَثِيرٗاۖ وَلَا تَزِدِ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ إِلَّا ضَلَٰلٗا
phonetic: 71.24 Wa Qad 'Ađallū Kathīrāan Wa Lā Tazidi Až-Žālimīna 'Illā Đalālāan

translations.english_saheeh: And already they have misled many. And, [my Lord], do not increase the wrongdoers except in error."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "And indeed they have led many astray. And (O Allâh): ‘Grant no increase to the Zâlimûn (polytheists, wrong-doers, and disbelievers) save error.’"
translations.english_rwwad: They have led many astray. So [O Lord], do not increase the wrongdoers except in error.”

arabic_text: مِّمَّا خَطِيٓـَٰٔتِهِمۡ أُغۡرِقُواْ فَأُدۡخِلُواْ نَارٗا فَلَمۡ يَجِدُواْ لَهُم مِّن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ أَنصَارٗا
phonetic: 71.25 Mimmā Khaţī'ātihim 'Ughriqū Fa'udkhilū Nārāan Falam Yajidū Lahum Min Dūni Allāhi 'Anşārāan

translations.english_saheeh: Because of their sins they were drowned and put into the Fire, and they found not for themselves besides Allāh [any] helpers.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Because of their sins they were drowned, then were made to enter the Fire. And they found none to help them instead of Allâh.
translations.english_rwwad: Because of their sins they were drowned and then were cast into the Fire, and they did not find any helpers against Allah.

arabic_text: وَقَالَ نُوحٞ رَّبِّ لَا تَذَرۡ عَلَى ٱلۡأَرۡضِ مِنَ ٱلۡكَٰفِرِينَ دَيَّارًا
phonetic: 71.26 Wa Qāla Nūĥun Rabbi Lā Tadhar `Alá Al-'Arđi Mina Al-Kāfirīna Dayyārāan

translations.english_saheeh: And Noah said, "My Lord, do not leave upon the earth from among the disbelievers an inhabitant.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And Nûh (Noah) said: "My Lord! Leave not one of the disbelievers on the earth!
translations.english_rwwad: Noah said, “My Lord, do not leave on earth a single disbeliever.

arabic_text: إِنَّكَ إِن تَذَرۡهُمۡ يُضِلُّواْ عِبَادَكَ وَلَا يَلِدُوٓاْ إِلَّا فَاجِرٗا كَفَّارٗا
phonetic: 71.27 'Innaka 'In Tadharhum Yuđillū `Ibādaka Wa Lā Yalidū 'Illā Fājirāan Kaffārāan

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, if You leave them, they will mislead Your servants and not beget except [every] wicked one and [confirmed] disbeliever.
translations.english_hilali_khan: "If You leave them, they will mislead Your slaves, and they will beget none but wicked disbelievers.
translations.english_rwwad: For if You leave them, they will surely lead Your slaves astray and beget none but wicked disbelievers.

arabic_text: رَّبِّ ٱغۡفِرۡ لِي وَلِوَٰلِدَيَّ وَلِمَن دَخَلَ بَيۡتِيَ مُؤۡمِنٗا وَلِلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ وَٱلۡمُؤۡمِنَٰتِۖ وَلَا تَزِدِ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ إِلَّا تَبَارَۢا
phonetic: 71.28 Rabbi Aghfir Lī Wa Liwālidayya Wa Liman Dakhala Baytiya Mu'umināan Wa Lilmu'uminīna Wa Al-Mu'umināti Wa Lā Tazidi Až-Žālimīna 'Illā Tabārāan

translations.english_saheeh: My Lord, forgive me and my parents and whoever enters my house a believer and the believing men and believing women. And do not increase the wrongdoers except in destruction."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "My Lord! Forgive me, and my parents, and him who enters my home as a believer, and all the believing men and women. And to the Zâlimûn (polytheists, wrong-doers, and disbelievers) grant You no increase but destruction!"
translations.english_rwwad: My Lord, forgive me and my parents, and whoever enters my house as a believer, and all the believing men and women, and do not increase the wrongdoers except in ruin.”
